name: SSC Flight System
effect: The Ace can count any or all of their movement as flying.

name: Missile Launcher
effect: Attacks made with this weapon against targets that have Lock On ignore cover.

name: Barrel Roll
effect: The Ace performs a barrel roll, flying 6 spaces in any direction and causing the attack to miss. This movement ignores engagement and does not provoke reactions. This reaction can't be used if the Ace can't move (e.g. if it's Slowed or Immobilized).
trigger: A melee or ranged attack hits the Ace.

name: Strafe
effect: 1/round, the Ace can fly spaces equal to their Speed in any direction, automatically dealing {3/4/5} kinetic damage to one character below or adjacent to the path taken, plus any number of additional characters below or adjacent to the path taken who have Lock On (though Lock On must be consumed if used this way).

name: Missile Swarm
effect: This weapon deals double damage to characters with Lock On, and doesn’t affect allied characters (bonus damage is not doubled).

name: Full Throttle
effect: The Ace moves 10 spaces in any direction and gains soft cover until the end of their next turn.
trigger: An enemy character in line of sight moves.

name: Countermeasures
effect: Whenever the Ace would gain a condition from a hostile character (Impaired, Slowed, etc), it may spend a charge from this system to ignore that condition. The character that inflicted that condition then gains Lock On.

name: Emergency Jettison
effect: Whenever the Ace is destroyed, it instead moves up to its Speed and immediately lands, remaining at 1 HP. All of the Ace's systems and traits (but not weapons) are then disabled

name: Defense Net
effect:
The Aegis spreads a powerful, shimmering repulsion shield over a Burst 2 area. While active, the Aegis is Immobilized, but all ranged, melee, and tech attacks against characters or objects within the affected area that originate outside the area receive +2 Difficulty and cannot result in critical hits; whenever an attack receiving this Difficulty misses, the Aegis takes 2 Heat. Characters within the affected area may attack characters within and outside of the area normally.

Allied characters within the affected area also gain Immunity to Impaired and Slowed, and remove these conditions when they enter the area if they already have them.

This effect lasts until the Aegis ends it as a protocol or is destroyed. If the Aegis exceeds their Heat Cap, becomes Stunned, or becomes Jammed while the shield is active, the shield deactivates and can't be reactivated until the end of the Aegis' next turn.

name: Regenerative Shielding
effect: The Aegis has Immunity to Impaired and Slowed and can’t be critically hit.

name: Focused Shielding
effect: That character gains resistance to all damage from the attack, then the Defense Net is deactivated.
trigger: An allied character within your Defense Net area is hit by a ranged or melee attack.

name: Guardian
effect: Allied characters can use the Aegis for hard cover.

name: Ring of Fire
effect: Any hostile characters that start their turn inside the area affected by the Defense Net or that enter it for the first time in a round take 2 Heat and become Shredded until they leave the area.

name: Remote Projector
effect: When the Aegis activates Defense Net, it may choose a free space within Range 5 and generate a Burst 2 area centered on that space instead. All other effects of Defense Net remain the same while this remote field is active (e.g. the Aegis is Immobilized, etc).

name: HA Blackwall System
effect: As a full action, the Aegis generates a pitch-black wall of blinkspace 5 spaces high covering a line 10 area starting within range 5. All spaces must be free. The wall blocks line of sight, effects or attacks and provides hard cover. Characters that start their turn in the wall or who enter it on their turn roll 1d6. On a 4+ they are removed from play until the end of their next turn, when they reappear in a free space of their choice in Range 10 of the wall. If there are no free spaces, they return when a space becomes free. The wall lasts until the Aegis ends it as a quick action, or is destroyed. When it ends, characters remaining in blinkspace reappear.

name: Suppress
effect:
The Archer chooses a target within line of sight and Range 10: they become Impaired and the Archer gains the Moving Target reaction.

This effect lasts until the Archer uses Moving Target; the target damages the Archer or leaves the Archer’s line of sight; the Archer is Stunned, Jammed, or destroyed; the Archer chooses a new target for this action; or, the Archer ends it as a free action.

name: Moving Target
effect: The Archer makes an attack against them with the Light Machine Gun. This attack interrupts and resolves before the triggering movement
trigger: The Archer’s Suppress target starts to move.

name: Superior Sentinel
effect: The Archer gains +1 Accuracy on all attacks made as reactions (e.g., Overwatch).

name: Covering Fire
effect: The Archer creates a Blast 3 area within Range 10 and line of sight, and gains the Got Your Back reaction. This area lasts until the end of the Archer's next turn or until the Archer creates a new area, and this Reaction can be taken as many times per round as it is triggered.

name: Got Your Back
effect: The Archer may attack that character with the Light Machine Gun.
trigger: A character in the Covering Fire area makes an attack.

name: Impending Threat
effect: Moving Target's trigger now includes the target taking any action that does not target the Archer

name: Flush Out
effect: The Archer chooses a character within Range 10: that character must either move their Speed in a direction of the Archer's choice, or allow the Archer to attack them with the Light Machine Gun. This movement ignores engagement and does not provoke reactions.

name: Blinding Shells
effect: 1/round, after the Archer makes a successful attack, they may force their target to pass an Engineering save. On a failure, the target only has line of sight to adjacent spaces until the end of their next turn.

name: Fire and Maneuver
effect: The Archer may Boost. If they end this movement within Range 10 and line of sight of the triggering character, that character takes {3/4/5} kinetic damage.
trigger: An enemy character in line of sight moves.

name: Kai Bioplating
effect: The Assassin gains +1 Accuracy on all Agility checks; additionally, they climb and swim at normal speed, ignore difficult terrain, and, when making a standard move, can jump horizontally up to their Speed and vertically up to half their Speed (in any combination).

name: Heated Blade
effect: Deals double damage to Prone, Shredded, Immobilized, or Stunned targets (bonus damage is not doubled).

name: Assassin’s Mark
effect:
The Assassin chooses a character in line of sight. For the rest of the scene, these effects apply:
  • It has Resistance to that target’s damage.
  • Damage it deals to that target cannot be reduced.
  • It gains +1 Accuracy on all saves forced by that target, and the target makes all saves forced by the Assassin with +1 Difficulty.
The Assassin can only choose a new target if the current target is destroyed.

name: Leap
effect: The Assassin flies 6 spaces in any direction but must land on a surface. When they land, characters adjacent to the Assassin must succeed on an Agility save or be knocked Prone.

name: Spinning Kick
effect: The Assassin chooses a character next to them: they must pass a Hull save or be pushed 4 spaces away from the Assassin and knocked Prone.

name: Shroud Projector
effect: The Assassin sets off a charge, creating a Burst 3 concealing shroud. The Assassin gains soft cover within the affected area, and characters other than the Assassin fully inside or outside the area cannot draw line of sight into or out of the area. Characters partially within the area are not affected. The Heated Blade deals double damage to characters inside this area (as though they were Prone etc). This effect lasts until the end of the Assassin’s next turn, or until the Assassin uses this system again.

name: Explosive Knives
effect: The Assassin throws an explosive knife at a character within Range 5, making a ranged attack at {+2/+4/+6}. On a hit, the knife embeds itself in the target and explodes at the end of their next turn, dealing {4/6/8} explosive damage in a Burst 1 area and forcing the struck target to pass a Hull save or become Shredded until the end of their next turn.

name: Transfix
effect: The Assassin jams their blade into a vital part of an adjacent character: that character must pass an Engineering save or become Stunned. While Stunned this way, the Assassin becomes Immobilized.This effect lasts until the Assassin and the target are no longer adjacent or until the target takes structure damage.

name: Heavy Assault Rifle
effect: This weapon gains +1 Accuracy against targets that do not have cover.

name: Hunker Down
effect: The Assault gains Resistance to all damage from the attack, but becomes Slowed until the end of its next turn.
trigger: An attack hits the Assault, but damage hasn't been rolled yet.

name: Rank Discipline
effect: The Assault gains +1 Accuracy on all attacks, checks, and saves while adjacent to at least one allied character with the Mech tag.

name: Micro-Missile Barrage
effect: The Assault launches a Line 10 volley of micro-missiles. All characters within the affected area must succeed on a Hull save or take {6/8/10} explosive damage. On a successful save, they take half damage. Characters who do not have cover make this save with +1 Difficulty.

name: Fix and Flank
effect: The Assault may target them with Overwatch using the Heavy Assault Rifle, dealing half damage on hit.
trigger: A character who doesn't have cover from the Assault is successfully attacked by an allied character.

name: Stormtrooper
effect: When the Assault uses Hunker Down, instead of the normal effect, they may instead Boost and gain +1 Accuracy on all attacks, checks, and saves until the end of their next turn.

name: Graviton Lance
on_hit: Target is Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: Mobile Printer
effect: The Barricade prints a Size 2 cube in a free area within Range 3. The cube provides hard cover and is a single object with 20 HP and Evasion 5. The Barricade can only have one cube deployed at a time; if a new one is deployed, the first one dissolves.

name: Drag Down
effect: The Barricade makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, they take 2 AP Energy damage per space that they voluntarily move until the end of their next turn.

name: Bulwark Mods
effect: The Barricade ignores difficult terrain and dangerous terrain.

name: Spike Barrier
effect: The cube printed by Mobile Printer is covered in piercing spikes; the first time in a round any character besides the Barricade moves adjacent to it, that character takes {2/3/4} AP kinetic damage and must pass an Agility save or lose all their remaining movement as though they had become Engaged.

name: Extrudite
effect: The Barricade can print two separate cubes at a time with instead of one, and cubes no longer dissolve when new ones are printed. Replace Mobile Printer with Extruding Printer.

name: Extruding Printer
effect: The Barricade prints 2 Size 2 cubes in free areas within Range 3. The cubes provides hard cover and are each single objects with 20 HP and Evasion 5.

name: Seismic Repulsor
effect: The Barricade emits a seismic pulse from one of its printed cubes, creating a Burst 3 area around it. All non-flying characters within that area must pass a Hull save or be knocked 3 spaces back from the cube and knocked Prone. Allied characters affected this way (including the Barricade itself) are not knocked Prone. The cube is then destroyed.

name: Hunger/Pursuit Limpets
effect: The Barricade rapidly prints and deploys a field of tiny, mobile mines in a free Size 4 area adjacent to them. The affected area becomes difficult terrain; additionally, hostile characters that enter the area forthe first time in a round or start their turn there must pass a Systems save or be Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: Titan-Snare Drone
effect:
Snare Drone (Size 1/2, HP {5/8/10}, Evasion {10/12/14}, E-Defense {10/12/14}, Tags: Drone)

This drone can be printed and deployed to any free adjacent space. When hostile characters move into or start their turn within Range 3 of the drone, it emits a pulse, and they become Immobilized until the drone is destroyed.

name: Rotary Grenade Launcher
effect: An adjacent allied character can spend a quick action to reload this weapon.

name: Heavy Assault Shield
on_hit: Target must pass a Hull save or be knocked Prone.

name: Friendly Interdiction
effect: The Bastion and one allied character adjacent to it gain Resistance to all damage dealt by one character within line of sight. The Bastion may choose a new allied character or a new character to gain Resistance from as a protocol. The allied character loses Resistance if they break adjacency.

name: Guardian
effect: Allied characters can use the Bastion for hard cover.

name: Near-Threat Denial System
effect: When characters within Range 3 attack the Bastion or a character being protected by Friendly Interdiction, they take {2/3/4} AP explosive damage before rolling.

name: Siege Guardian
effect: Allied characters gain Resistance to damage from Blast, Burst, Line, and Cone attacks while they’re adjacent to the Bastion.

name: Fearless Defender
effect: The Bastion moves to a space adjacent to the triggering character and takes the damage instead. The Bastion may then immediately use Friendly Interdiction on the triggering character.
trigger: An allied character in range 5 of the Bastion takes damage, and the Bastion isn’t Immobilized, Slowed, Stunned or otherwise cannot move.

name: Deathcounter
effect: The Bastion is wreathed in a crackling energy field visible to all characters. The first time the Bastion is successfully hit by a ranged or melee attack each round, all damage is reduced to 0, after which the field visibly dissipates until the start of the next round.

name: Stack Up
effect: When the Bastion takes its standard move or Boosts, an adjacent allied character can choose to move with them, mirroring their movement. This allied character's movement ignores engagement and does not provoke reactions. Each allied character can only move a number of spaces this way each round equal to their Speed.

name: Chain Axe
effect: On Critical Hit: Target becomes Shredded until the end of their next turn.

name: Stampede Defense
effect: The Berserker has Resistance to all damage unless they are Impaired, Stunned, Immobilized, Shredded, Slowed or Exposed.

name: Aggression
effect: After taking damage for the first time each round, the Berserker must immediately attack a random adjacent character, hostile or allied, with the Chain Axe. This attack happens even if the Berserker is reduced to 0 HP.

name: Avalanche Charge
effect: The Berserker moves spaces equal to their Speed in a straight line, ignoring reactions and engagement, then attacks a random adjacent character – hostile or allied — with the Chain Axe.

name: Juggernaut
effect: When the Berserker uses Avalanche Charge, all characters adjacent to the path they follow or adjacent to their final position – hostile and allied – must succeed on a Hull save or be knocked Prone.

name: Harpoon Cannon
on_hit: Targets of smaller or equal Size to the Berserker are pulled adjacent to them in a straight line,or as close as possible. If they’re larger, the Berserker is pulled adjacent to them instead. If this ends with the Berserker adjacent to the target, the Berserker Grapples them.

name: Retribution
effect: Whenever the Berserker takes damage, their next attack deals +1d6 bonus damage. This bonus damage is lost when the Berserker attacks, or at the end of their next turn.

name: Headhunter
effect: Whenever the Berserker attacks a target that is Grappled, Immobilized, Stunned, or Prone with the Chain Axe, they become Shredded on hit rather than on critical hit.

name: Overdrive Servos
effect: The Berserker counts as Size 3 for Ram and Grapple, and they deal {3/4/5} kinetic damage on hit with Ram and Grapple.

name: Cluster Munitions
effect: The Bombard’s attacks deal {+2/+3/+4} damage to all characters for each targeted character beyond the first.

name: Earthshaker Shells
effect: When attacking with the Bombard Cannon, the Bombard may also fire a special earthshaker shell. In addition to any damage, one character within the Blast must pass a Hull save or be knocked Prone. Debris or broken earth is thrown up by the impact, creating two Size 1 segments of hard cover in free spaces within Range 3 of the targeted space. The Bombard Cannon must then be reloaded before it can be used again (as though it was Loading) unless two or more characters were targeted by this attack.

name: Siege Armor
effect: The Bombard has Resistance to all damage from attacks that originate beyond range 3.

name: High-Impact Shells
effect: When attacking with the Bombard Cannon, the Bombard may fire a special high-impact shell. On hit, characters are knocked back 2 spaces either directly away from the Bombard or away from the center of the Blast, +1 space for each targeted character beyond the first, up to a maximum of 5 spaces. The Bombard Cannon must then be reloaded before it can be used again (as though it was Loading) unless two or more characters were targeted by this attack. Only one type of special shell can be fired at a time.

name: Bunker Buster
effect: When attacking with the Bombard Cannon, the Bombard may fire a special bunker buster shell. The Bombard Cannon automatically deals {10/20/30} AP explosive damage to all objects and terrain in the affected area, and one character must pass a Hull save or become Shredded until the end of their next turn. The Bombard Cannon must then be reloaded before it can be used again (as though it was Loading) unless two or more characters were targeted by this attack. Only one type of special shell can be fired at a time.

name: Flare Drone
effect:
Flare Drone (Size 1/2, HP {10/15/20}, Evasion {10/10/10}, E-Defense {10/10/10}, Tags: Drone)

This drone can be deployed to a space within line of sight and Range 25, where it hovers in place and begins projecting bright light in a Burst 2 area. All characters in the affected area – including those that move into the affected area or start their turn within it – lose Invisible and Hidden, and cannot Hide or turn Invisible within the area. Additionally, the Bombard gains +1 Accuracy to attacks against characters within the affected area (including the drone itself). The Bombard can only have one drone deployed at a time; if a new drone is deployed, the old one disintegrates.

name: High-Angle Fire
effect: The Bombard may prepare a delayed, high-angle shot with the Bombard Cannon. Choose a Blast 3 area, which becomes visible to all characters; the Bombard then makes an attack at the end of the next round with the Bombard Cannon, after all characters have acted, against every target within the area.

name: Counterbattery Suite
effect: The triggering character gains Lock On. This Reaction can't be used against characters within Range 3 of the Bombard.
trigger: A hostile character makes an attack against the Bombard.

name: Dual Shotguns
effect: This weapon can make two attacks at once, targeting either the same character or different ones. The final attack rolls for this weapon can never be affected by Accuracy.

name: Breach Ram
effect: The Breacher moves up to 6 spaces in a straight line, ignoring engagement and passing through – but not stopping in – spaces occupied by other characters. Obstructions and objects in the Breacher’s path take 30 AP kinetic damage. The Breacher passes through any obstructions destroyed this way and continues moving until they have moved 6 spaces or fail to destroy an obstruction. Any characters in the Breacher’s path must succeed on an Agility save or be pushed out of the way as directly as possible and knocked Prone.

name: Break Armor
effect: Characters that are successfully attacked more than once in a turn by the Breacher’s Dual Shotguns become Shredded for the rest of the scene.

name: Ram Plating
effect: The Breacher gains +1 Accuracy to Ram.

name: Follower Count
effect: The Breacher makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the Breacher gains +1 Accuracy on all attacks against their target, and may Boost once per turn as a free action so long as it moves them directly towards their target. This lasts until either character is destroyed and cannot be changed to a new target unless the Breacher takes 4 Heat to attempt this tech attack against a different target.

name: Thermal Charge
effect: The Breacher may expend a charge to throw a grenade to a space within Range 5. Characters in the ensuing Blast 1 explosion must pass an Agility save or take {2/3/4} Burn and become Shredded until the end of their next turn. Objects, terrain, and Deployables in the area automatically take 30 AP explosive damage; if any objects or terrain are destroyed this way, the Breacher may immediately move their Speed towards one of those spaces or as close as possible.

name: Painmaker
effect: The Breacher prepares a salvo of shells, becoming Slowed until the end of their next turn. This effect is visible to everyone. During the Breacher's next turn, the next time they use the Dual Shotguns, they may make four attacks at once instead of two.

name: Fragmentation Shells
effect: 1/round, when the Breacher makes a successful attack with the Dual Shotguns, a different character within Range 3 of the target takes {2/3/4} kinetic damage + bonus damage equal to the initial target's Armor.

name: Breach and Clear
effect: When using Breach Ram, the Breacher may also attack any character in their path with the Dual Shotguns. The Dual Shotguns only make a single attack against each character this way (rather than making two attacks at once), and these attacks deal half damage on hit.

name: Ram Cannon
effect: This lance can be used as either a ranged or melee weapon, but not both in the same turn. When used as a ranged weapon, Critical Hits cause the target to become Impaired until the end of their next turn. When used as a melee weapon, it gains Knockback 2.

name: Trample
effect: The Cataphract ignores engagement and can pass through – but not stop in – spaces occupied by other characters, 1/turn dealing {2/3/4} kinetic damage to those characters.

name: Impale
effect: The Cataphract moves up to 8 spaces in a straight line. Pick a character that the Cataphract passed through or ended adjacent to; they must pass a Hull save. On a failure, they are grappled by the Cataphract and pulled with the Cataphract to the end of their movement. On Critical Hit with the Ram Cannon, this system automatically Recharges.

name: Point-Defense Shield
effect: The Cataphract has Resistance to all damage from the closest hostile character. If multiple characters are equally close, this effect does not apply.

name: Electrified Lasso
effect: A character in line of sight and Range 5 must make a Hull save. On a failure, they take {2/3/4} Heat and are pulled as close as possible to the Cataphract; if they become adjacent, the Cataphract automatically grapples them.

name: Lance Shot
effect: The Cataphract fires a piercing lance in a Line 5 path. All characters within the affected area must pass a Hull save or be knocked back 3 spaces. Any character that collides with an obstruction or another character also becomes Immobilized until the end of their next turn.

name: Electromagnetic Bola
effect: A flying character in Range 10 must pass an Agility save. On a failure, they are pulled 3 spaces, land immediately, and become Immobilized until the end of their next turn. This counts as falling but without damage.

name: Charge
effect: The Cataphract moves spaces equal to their Speed in a straight line, ignoring reactions and engagement, then attacks a target within Range with the Ram Cannon.

name: Capacitor Discharge
effect: As long as the Cataphract isn't Slowed or Jammed, whenever characters make melee attacks against them, they take {2/3/4} Heat before rolling.

name: Demolition Hammer
on_hit: Targets must succeed on a Hull save or be Stunned until the end of their next turn.

name: Earthshatter
effect: On Attack: The Demolisher deals 10/20/30 AP kinetic damage to an object or piece of terrain within Range 2, if there is one. Hit or miss, place a Size 1 piece of terrain that grants hard cover in a free space adjacent to your target. The terrain has 10 HP and Evasion 5. This weapon does not need to be retrieved between uses

name: Shock Armor
effect: The Demolisher has Resistance to damage from melee weapons.

name: Heavy Frame
effect: The Demolisher can’t be pushed, pulled, knocked Prone, or knocked back by smaller characters.

name: Jet Propulsion
effect: Whenever the Demolisher makes an attack with the Demolition Hammer, it may take 4 Heat to move 4 spaces in a straight line directly towards the target before the attack.

name: Kinetic Compensation
effect: Each time the Demolisher misses with the Demolition Hammer, they gain +1 Accuracy on all subsequent attacks with it until they hit. This Accuracy can be gained multiple times and stacks.

name: Seismic Destroyer
effect: Unless they can fly, all characters in a Cone 5 area pass an Agility save or be knocked Prone. All objects and terrain within this area takes {10/20/30} AP kinetic damage; if any terrain or objects are destroyed this way, all affected characters also automatically take {4/6/8} kinetic damage.

name: Hullcracker
effect: The Demolisher chooses a character within Range 2: they must pass a Hull save or be Immobilized and Shredded until the end of their next turn.

name: Drag Cables
effect:
The Demolisher chooses a character within Range 5; that character must pass a Hull save or become embedded with high-tensile cable anchors. While these anchors are embedded, neither the target nor the Demolisher can move more than 5 spaces away from one another. If the target is smaller than the Demolisher, they move when the Demolisher moves, mirroring their movements. The Demolisher can activate this system again and force an embedded character to pass another Hull save or be pulled adjacent to the Demolisher.

An embedded character can remove the cables on a hit with a melee attack against Evasion 10. Otherwise, this effect lasts until the end of the scene, until either character is destroyed, or until the Demolisher uses this system on a new target.

name: Flak Cannon
effect: This weapon gains +1 Accuracy against flying targets.

name: Deployable Turret
effect:
Deployable Turret (Size 1/2, HP {1/1/1}, Evasion {10/10/10}, E-Defense {10/10/10}, Tags: Drone)

Up to two of these self-constructing turrets can be deployed to any free space within Range 3. At the end of Engineer’s turn, deployed turrets attack the nearest hostile character within Range 10. They attack at +{1/2/3} and deal {4/5/6} Kinetic damage. The Engineer may have six turrets deployed at one time; if they deploy additional turrets beyond this, previous turrets of their choice are destroyed until they have no more than six total.

All turrets are destroyed when the Engineer is destroyed. If the Engineer becomes Jammed or Stunned, their turrets are also disabled for the duration of those conditions instead of attacking.

name: Target Designator
effect:
The Engineer chooses a character within line of sight and Sensors; they gain Lock On. At the end of the Engineer's turn, up to two of their Deployable Turrets will attack that target (if it is within range) instead of attacking the nearest hostile character.

This trait automatically recharges whenever two or more Deployable Turrets are destroyed by hostile characters before the end of the Engineer's next turn.

name: Deployable Fortifications
effect: Deployable Turrets are Size 1, and adjacent allied characters can use them for hard cover.

name: Perimiter Defense
effect: Deployable Turrets gain Threat 3 and can Overwatch (1/round per turret), and the Engineer gains the Auto-Tracking reaction.

name: Auto-Tracking
effect: The Deployable Turret makes an attack against the triggering character's target, as long as the target is within line of sight and Range.
trigger: An allied character within Range 3 of a Deployable Turret makes a successful attack.

name: Mobile Turrets
effect: At the start of the Engineer’s turn, they may move two Deployable Turrets up to 3 spaces in any direction.

name: Skyshield Protocol
effect: Deployable Turrets gain +1 Accuracy against flying targets.

name: Repurpose
effect: The Engineer chooses an allied character adjacent to one of their Deployable Turrets; that character either gains {3/4/5} Overshield or gains +1 Accuracy on all attacks, checks and saves until the end of their next turn. The turret is then destroyed.

name: Drum Shotgun
effect: This weapon ignores ranged penalties from Engaged.

name: Crush Targeting
effect: A hostile character within Sensors and line of sight gains +3 Difficulty to attack against any character other than the Goliath until the start of the Goliath’s next turn. This effect does not stack, and the effect ends immediately if the Goliath becomes Jammed or Stunned.

name: Towering Stride
effect: The Goliath can end its turn overlapping obstructions, cover, and terrain smaller than Size 3.

name: Heavy Frame
effect: The Goliath can’t be pushed, pulled, knocked Prone, or knocked back by smaller characters.

name: Guardian
effect: Adjacent allied characters can use the Goliath for hard cover.

name: Power Knuckle
effect: A character within Range 2 must pass a Hull save or take {4/5/6} Kinetic damage, be pushed 5 spaces directly away from the Goliath, and knocked Prone.

name: Pin
effect: A character within Range 2 becomes Immobilized and Impaired until they either damage the Goliath, the Goliath is Stunned or destroyed, or the Goliath targets another character with this effect. The Goliath is Immobilized for the duration of this effect.

name: Mag Gauntlet
effect: A character within Sensors and line of sight must pass a Hull save or be pulled 3 spaces towards the Goliath. If they are pulled adjacent to the Goliath (or are already adjacent to them), they automatically become grappled. The Goliath can only grapple one character this way at a time, and can't use this system while grappling someone this way.

name: Coercive Force
effect: All characters of the Goliath's choice within Sensors are pulled 2 spaces towards the Goliath.

name: Attractor Field
effect: The Goliath becomes the target of the attack instead. If the attack was an area of effect, such as a Line, Cone, Blast, etc, the attacker must now position it so it targets the Goliath, or as close as possible, which could change its targets. This transfer takes place even if the attack could not have hit the Goliath (i.e. it was a melee attack).
trigger: An allied character within Range 2 and line of sight is targeted by an attack dealing kinetic or explosive damage.

name: Razor Swarm
effect: The Hive deploys a Blast 1 razor swarm in a free area within Sensors. Allied characters gain soft cover as long as they are at least partially within the affected area. Hostile characters that start their turn at least partially within the area or move into it for the first time in a round take {2/3/4} Burn. At the start of the Hive's turn, they may move the Razor Swarm up to 2 spaces in any direction, including into spaces occupied by other characters. Only a single Razor Swarm may be deployed at a time, and if a new one is deployed (or the Hive is destroyed) the old one is destroyed.

name: Drone Barrage
effect: The Hive makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target chooses one: they become Immobilized and Impaired until the end of their next turn, or they immediately move up to 4 spaces in a direction chosen by the Hive. This movement ignores engagement and does not provoke reactions.

name: Driving Swarm
effect: Whenever characters take Burn from a Razor Swarm, they must pass a Systems save or immediately move 4 spaces in a direction chosen by the Hive after taking damage. This movement ignores engagement and does not provoke reactions.

name: Harrier Maniple
effect: The Hive releases a swarm of tiny drones and makes a tech attack against a hostile character within Sensors. On a success, the Hive pushes the target up to 2 spaces in a direction of their choice and the drones create a swarming Burst 2 area centered around them that lasts until the end of their next turn. All other hostile characters that start their turn at least partially within the area or move into it for the first time in a round take {2/3/4} Burn. This counts as taking Burn from a Razor Swarm.

name: Solipsis Swarm
effect: At the start of their turn, characters within Range 3 of the Hive take {2/3/4} Burn. This counts as taking Burn from a Razor Swarm.

name: Electro-Nanite Payloads
effect: Until the end of their next turn, any character that takes Burn from the Hive or a Razor Swarm makes all checks and saves at +1 Difficulty, and all Tech Attacks are made against them with +1 Accuracy. This effect of this trait does not stack.

name: Command Override
effect: The Hive chooses up to three Drones within Sensors (including those belonging to other characters) and moves them 3 spaces in any direction. Then all characters adjacent to any of those Drones must pass a Systems save or take {2/3/4} Burn and gain Lock On. This counts as taking Burn from a Razor Swarm.

name: Stinger Pistol
on_hit: Targets become Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: SSC Total Suite
effect: The Hornet can hover whenever they move.

name: Weave
effect: Each round, the first attack made against the Hornet as a reaction automatically fails.

name: Impale Systems
effect: The Hornet makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a hit, they take {3/4/5} Heat and become Jammed until the end of their next turn.

name: Supersonic
effect: The Hornet flies to a space in line of sight and Range 50 so impossibly fast that it counts as teleportation. If they end this movement within Range 5 of another character, that character becomes Impaired until the end of their next turn and this ability automatically recharges; if multiple characters are within Range 5, the Hornet chooses only one of them to become Impaired.

name: Umbral Interdiction
effect: If the target is not Impaired, they immediately become Impaired until the end of their next turn; this interrupts and resolves before the triggering attack. If the target is Impaired, they must pass a Systems check or their attack automatically misses.
trigger: A character within Sensors and line of sight attempts an attack.

name: System Spike
effect: Hostile Impaired characters within the Hornet's Sensors recieve +2 Difficulty on all attacks, checks, and saves instead of +1 Difficulty.

name: Slingshot
effect: The Hornet makes a tech attack against a character in Sensors. On a success, they take {3/4/5} Heat and are pushed 3 spaces in a direction of the Hornet's choice, then the Hornet moves to any free space within Range 5 of the target as directly as possible.

name: Lock/Hold Javelins
effect: The Hornet fires a javelin at a character within Range 5 and line of sight. The target must succeed on a Hull save or be impaled, at which point the javelin tethers itself and its victim to the ground (or another surface), rendering them Immobilized and Shredded. They, or any adjacent character, can attempt to remove the javelin with a successful Hull save as a full action; otherwise, this effect lasts for the rest of the scene or until the Hornet takes this action again.

name: Warp Sensors
effect: The Mirage makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, they take {2/3/4} heat and all attacks they make until the end of their next turn treat their targets as having soft cover.

name: Dataveil
effect: By default, the Mirage is Invisible. They can transfer this status to another character within line of sight as a quick action. When they do so, the Mirage ceases to be Invisible, and as a quick action they may transfer it back to themselves or to another character; otherwise, this effect lasts until the Mirage is destroyed.

name: Glitch Scanners
effect: The Mirage’s advanced electronic countermeasures play havoc with enemy systems, causing them to register false positives on the battlefield. They may teleport up to two allied characters within Sensors, moving them 5 spaces in any direction – revealing their “true” locations.

name: Blip
effect: The Mirage may teleport one allied character within Sensors 5 spaces in any direction.
trigger: A hostile character takes action in line of sight.

name: Illusory Subroutines
effect: The Mirage makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target treats all characters allied to the Mirage as Invisible until the start of the Mirage's next turn.

name: Warp Targeting
effect: All allied characters within Sensors benefit from special digital soft cover; this stacks with other sources of soft cover, giving +2 Difficulty on ranged attacks against characters benefiting from both instead of +1 (digital soft cover does not stack). If the Mirage takes damage, this effect ends until the start of their next turn.

name: Metafold Shove
effect: The Mirage makes a tech attack against a hostile character within Sensors. On a success, the target swaps places with an allied character within the Mirage's line of sight and within Range 5 of the target, both characters teleporting. Flying characters can’t be swapped with characters that aren’t flying, and vice versa.

name: Manifest False Idols
effect: The Mirage creates three Size 1 data constructs in free spaces within line of sight and Range 5. These constructs provide soft cover, but don't block line of sight and can be passed through. When hostile characters pass through a construct, it disappears and they must pass a Systems save or take {2/3/4} heat and become Jammed until the end of their next turn. During the Mirage’s turn, they can teleport an allied character within line of sight to the location of a data construct as a quick action, causing the construct to disappear, as long as there is sufficient free space for them to end this movement in.

name: Multiplicity
effect: The attacker must pass a Systems save, or the target gains Resistance to all damage from the attack. On a success, the attack does damage as normal, but the Mirage may then teleport the target up to 5 spaces in any direction and that character gains soft cover until the end of their next turn.
trigger: A allied character in line of sight and Sensors is hit by an attack.

name: Trace Drive
effect: The Operator teleports when they make their standard move. Whenever the Operator exceeds their Heat Cap, this system is disabled until the end of their next turn.

name: Strike and Fade
effect: Whenever the Operator teleports during their turn before making any attacks, they gain +1 Accuracy on all attacks with the Raptor Plasma Rifle until the end of their turn. Whenever the Operator teleports during their turn after making any attacks, all attacks against them recieve +1 Difficulty until the end of their next turn. If the Operator splits their movement with an attack, they may only choose one of these effects.

name: Self-Erasure
effect: When the Operator is destroyed, it immediately self-immolates in a wave of superheated plasma. All characters adjacent to the Operator when this takes place must succeed on an Agility save or take {4/6/8} Energy damage and rendered only able to draw line of sight to adjacent spaces until the end of their next. On a success, they take half damage only. This mech is then removed from the battlefield – it is utterly annihilated.

name: Telefrag
effect: The Operator teleports into a space occupied by another character within line of sight and range 15. The target must succeed on an Agility save or take {4/5/6} AP Energy damage and become Jammed and Shredded until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, they take half damage only. Succeed or fail, the Operator takes 1d6 AP Energy damage and then teleports to a new space within Range 5.

name: Overload Shot
effect: The Operator makes an attack with the Raptor Plasma Rifle, treating its Range as Line 10.

name: Fade Generator
effect: The Operator teleports their Speed. They may take 1d6 Heat to also become Invisible until the start of their next turn.
trigger: The Operator takes damage from a ranged or melee attack.

name: Singularity Grenade
effect:
The Operator may expend a charge to throw a grenade to a space within Range 5. Characters in the Blast 2 energy pulse (excluding the Operator) must pass a Systems save or be teleported 2 spaces in a direction of the Operator's choice and treat the Operator as Invisible until the end of their next turn.

The Operator then teleports their Speed.

name: Deniable Asset
effect: Self Erasure now deals {6/8/10} damage (half on a successful save), and when the Operator is destroyed they may immediately teleport their Speed as a Reaction before self-immolating.

name: Abjure
effect: The Priest makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target takes {2/3/4} heat each time they make any attack roll until the end of their next turn.

name: Hardened Target
effect: The Priest gains +1 Accuracy on Systems saves, and tech attacks against them receive +1 Difficulty.

name: Investiture
effect: The Priest links systems with an allied mech or vehicle within Range 5. As long as they remain linked and within Range 5, the target gets +1 Accuracy on all attacks and gains the benefits of Hardened Target. If either character becomes Jammed or Stunned, however, the other character also receives the condition for the same duration or until the link is disabled. The link is disabled if either character is destroyed or moves more than 5 spaces from the other. The Priest can only link with one character at a time.

name: Dispersal Shield
effect: The Priest releases a cloud of miniature drones that cluster around a nearby mech, providing protection. The Priest or an allied character within Sensors gains {5/6/7} Overshield and Resistance to damage and heat from the next attack that hits. This effect does not stack.

name: Fortress
effect: Hardened Target gives +3 Accuracy on Systems saves and deals +3 Difficulty on tech attacks, instead of +1.

name: Empowered Investiture
effect: The Priest pushes their Investiture link to its limit, becoming Immobilized while linked this way. The linked character gains Immunity to Impaired and Slowed (and clears them if they already have those conditions), Resistance to all damage and heat, and no longer needs to remain within Range 5 of the Priest. This effect lasts until the end of the linked character's next turn. When this effect ends, the link ends as well, and the Priest becomes Stunned until the end of their next turn.

name: Sanctuary
effect: The Priest chooses an allied character within Sensors. Before attempting to attack that character, characters must first pass a Systems save. On a failure, they don't lose the action, but can't target the protected character again until the start of their next turn. This effect lasts until the Priest is destroyed or until the end of the Priest's next turn.

name: Fractal Assault
effect: The triggering character must choose one; the damage from the triggering effect is reduced to 0 and this reaction automatically recharges, or the triggering character becomes Stunned until the end of their next turn.
trigger: A character linked by Investiture takes damage.

name: Feedback
effect: Whenever a tech attack misses the Priest or a character linked by Investiture, the attacker takes {2/3/4} heat.

name: Flamethrower
effect: This weapon deals double Burn to characters that already have any Burn.

name: Firebreak
effect: At the end of the Pyro's turn, they create a Line 5 wall of flame, 4 spaces high, in free spaces within Range 3 and line of sight. This wall doesn't block line of sight, but provides soft cover; when an attack is made against a character benefiting from this cover, roll 1d6. On a 4+, that attack misses. Characters can pass through this wall, but when crossing the wall for the first time in a round or starting their turn overlapping its spaces, they take {2/3/4} Burn. This wall lasts until the start of the Pyro's next turn, or until the Pyro moves or is Stunned, and its effect doesn't stack with Invisible.

name: Explosive Vent
effect: The Pyro clears all heat. All characters within Burst 2 must pass an Agility save or take heat equal to half the amount the Pyro cleared and be knocked Prone.

name: Insulated
effect: The Pyro has Immunity to Burn.

name: Napalm Bomb
effect: The Pyro launches a napalm canister that erupts in a Blast 1 curtain of flame within Range 5. All characters within this area must pass an Agility save or take {2/3/4} Burn and {2/3/4} Heat. The Pyro may instead target a free area with this Blast; if they do, it creates a burning patch on the ground that lasts until this system is used again. Characters that start their turn at least partially within the area or move into it for the first time in a round must pass an Agility save or take {2/3/4} Burn and {2/3/4 Heat}.

name: Unshielded Reactor
effect: Characters that start their turn within Range 3 of the Pyro or who move into Range 3 of them for the first time in a round take 2/3/4 Heat, and they make all checks to clear Burn with +1 Difficulty as long as they remain within 3 spaces of the Pyro.

name: Superhot
effect: The Pyro gains Resistance to all damage from the attack. If the attack was a melee attack, the triggering character must pass an Engineering save or take {3/4/5} Burn.
trigger: The Pyro takes damage from an attack.

name: Explosive Jet
effect: Hostile characters within Burst 2 must pass a Hull save or be knocked back outside of the area and knocked Prone. The Pyro then flies 5 spaces in any direction, but must land after completing that move. If the Pyro is in the Danger Zone, the Hull save is made with +1 Difficulty and this system's Recharge rolls automatically succeed.

name: Lingering Flames
effect: When the Pyro attacks with the Flamethrower, flames continue to Burn in 3 free spaces of their choice within the affected area. When characters start their turn in one of these spaces or enter one for the first time in a round, they take {2/3/4} Burn. These spaces last until the end of the scene, or until the Pyro attacks with the Flamethrower.

name: Missile Pods
effect: This weapon can attack 1-3 characters at a time.

name: Huntsman
effect: Against characters with Lock On, the Missile Pods gain Smart and Seeking. If the Rainmaker consumes Lock On during the attack, the Missile Pods also gain AP against that target.

name: Skyhammer Salvo
effect: The Rainmaker establishes a Blast 1 targeting area within line of sight and Sensors, visible to all characters. Hostile characters that start their turn within this area (even partially, up to 10 spaces high) or enter it for the first time during their turn gain Lock On. Hostile characters that end their turn within this area are hit by a rocket, taking {4/5/6} explosive damage. This area lasts until the start of the Rainmaker's next turn.

name: Hound Missiles
effect:
Hound Missile (Size 1/2, HP {10/12/14}, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone, Immunity to Prone, Slowed, and Immobilized).

The Rainmaker deploys the Hound Missile in an adjacent space and picks a target in Range 15 and line of sight. At the start of the Rainmaker’s turns the missile makes its own standard move, flying 3 spaces towards its target, 6 if the target has Lock On. It moves directly, maneuvering around cover and terrain if needed. When the missile moves adjacent to its target, or collides with any character, it creates a Burst 1 explosion. Characters in the affected area must pass an Agility save or take {16/20/24} explosive damage. On a success, they take half damage.

Any hostile character that attempts to move a Hound Missile (i.e. with Knockback, push, pull, etc) must pass a contested Systems check against the Rainmaker. If they fail, the movement is ignored, that character gains Lock On, and the Rainmaker may change the missile's target to that character

name: Atlas Missiles
effect: The Rainmaker chooses a space on the ground in line of sight and Range 15, visible to all characters. The Rainmaker launches a missile that lands at the end of the next round, creating a Blast 2 explosion centered on that space. Characters in the area must pass an Agility save or take {16/20/24} explosive damage. On a success they take half damage. The Rainmaker can force hostile characters with Lock On make this save with +1 Difficulty, but they must consume the Lock On during the save.

name: Hades Missiles
effect: The Rainmaker launches a missile that detonates in a Cone 3 area within Range 15; this doesn't need line of sight, just a possible route to the target. All characters within the area must pass a Hull save or take {4/5/6} explosive damage and be knocked back 3 spaces in the direction of the cone. On a save, they take half damage and are knocked back 1 space.

name: Seeker Volley
effect: All hostile characters in line of sight and Range 15 must pass a Systems save or gain Lock On and take {4/5/6} explosive damage. On a success, they take half damage only.

name: Suppression Salvo
effect: When hostile characters end their turn within the Skyhammer Salvo targeting area, the Rainmaker may hit them with a rocket that deals no damage, but forces them to pass a Hull save or become Slowed and Impaired until the end of their next turn instead.

name: Rebound
effect: They roll 1d6: on 4+, they gain Resistance to damage from that attack, and the attacker must repeat the attack against themselves. On 3 or less, the Ronin may Boost towards the triggering attacker.
trigger: The Ronin takes damage from a ranged attack.

name: Counter-Ballistic Suite
effect: Whenever a hostile character within Range 5 makes a ranged attack, the Ronin may give them a Ronin's Mark. Only one character at a time can have a Ronin's Mark; if a new mark is applied, any others are removed. When the Ronin makes a successful attack against a character using the Carbon Fiber Sword, it can consume the Ronin's Mark to deal +1d6 bonus damage.

name: Chaff Launchers
effect: Ranged attacks against the Ronin while Engaged receive +2 Difficulty instead of +1 Difficulty, and the Ronin gains soft cover until the start of their next turn whenever they Boost.

name: Instinct Mode
effect: The Ronin enters a prepared stance, visible to everyone. Until the end of the Ronin’s next turn, the first time each turn that a hostile character in line of sight makes a ranged attack, as a reaction the Ronin may first Boost towards the triggering attacker and then make an attack against them with the Carbon Fiber Sword if they are within Range.

name: Mag Field
effect: Whenever the Ronin takes damage or effects from missed attacks (e.g. Reliable), they may choose a different character within Range 5 to also take the damage or effects.

name: Charged Slash
effect: A character within Range 2 must pass an Agility save or choose: become Jammed until the end of their next turn, or the Ronin chooses one of their equipped weapons and they take that weapon's damage from a ruptured magazine or power cell, then they become Impaired until the end of their next turn. On a success, they become Impaired until the end of their next turn only.

name: Extended Blade
effect: The Ronin’s Carbon Fiber Sword becomes Threat 3. The first time each turn that the Ronin performs a critical hit with it, all characters of their choice within Threat take {2/3/4} Kinetic damage, excluding the target just attacked.

name: Focus Down
effect: When the Scourer hits with the Thermal Lance, targets take {5/6/7} Burn if they were also successfully hit with the Thermal Lance in the previous round.

name: Cooling Module
effect: At the start of their turn, the Scourer clears all Heat if they haven’t moved – including involuntary movement – since the end of their previous turn.

name: Ablative Shielding
effect: The Scourer has Resistance to Energy damage.

name: Supercharged
effect: Characters affected by Focus Down are also Shredded and Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: Emergency Vent
effect: When the Scourer exceeds their Heat Cap, becomes Jammed, or becomes Stunned, they become Invisible until the start of their next turn.

name: Pulse Laser
effect: The next time the Scourer makes an attack with the Thermal Lance, they can attack two targets at a time, dealing half damage on hit. This system automatically recharges whenever Cooling Module activates.

name: Melt
effect: The Scourer makes a ranged attack against an object, deployable or Drone within Range 10, dealing 20 AP Energy damage on a success. On hit, all characters within a Burst 2 radius of the target are splashed with molten slag, and count as being successfully hit with the Thermal Lance.

name: Thermal Overload
effect: If the Cooling Module does not activate at the start of the Scourer's turn, the Thermal Lance gains +4 Range, and on hit all other characters in a Burst 1 area around the target take {3/4/5} Burn.

name: Marker Rifle
on_hit: Target receives Lock On, and they become Shredded until the end of their next turn.

name: Sight
effect: The Scout ignores Hidden and Invisible.

name: Rebound Scan
effect: The Scout makes a tech attack against a character in Sensors. On a success, the target and all hostile characters within Range 3 of the target lose Hidden and Invisible and can't regain either status or benefit from any cover until the start of the Scout's next turn. The Scout may choose to automatically hit allied characters with this tech attack; if they do, this system automatically recharges.

name: Cloaking Field
effect: The Scout generates a Burst 3 cloaking field that lasts until the end of their next turn. The Scout and allied characters within the affected area are Invisible, but the Scout is Immobilized while it is active.

name: Spotter
effect: While adjacent to the Scout, allied characters gain +1 Accuracy on all attack rolls.

name: Sensor Link
effect: The Scout chooses an allied character within Range 3 and patches their own sensor feed directly into that ally's systems, becoming Immobilized until the end of their next turn. That character gains the benefits of Sight. This effect lasts until the Scout is destroyed or until the end of the Scout's next turn

name: Orbital Strike
effect: The Scout chooses a space on the ground, within line of sight and Range 20; all characters know that it has been chosen. The Scout calls in an orbital bombardment that hits at the end of the next round, creating a Burst 2 explosion. Characters in the affected area must make Agility saves. On a fail, they take {12/16/20} Energy damage and are knocked Prone. On a success, they take half damage and remain standing.

name: Expose Weakness
effect:
Characters that are successfully attacked with the Marker Rifle gain a Scout's Mark. Only one character can be marked this way at a time, and marking another character clears any marks from the last one. The next time an ally successfully hits a character with a Scout's Mark, they may consume the mark to choose one of the following:
  • The Target takes +1d6 bonus damage.
  • The target is knocked Prone.
  • The target is pushed 2 spaces in a direction of the attacker's choice and Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Pathfinder
effect: After the Scout successfully attacks with the Marker Rifle, an allied character within Sensors and line of sight can Boost as a reaction.

name: Grav-Grenade Launcher
on_hit: Targets are pulled 1 space in a direction of the Seeder's choice.

name: Lay Mines
effect:
The Seeder deploys one of the mines below in a free space within Range 3. Once deployed, the Seeder’s mines detonate when a hostile character moves adjacent to them, creating a Burst 1 explosion that affects both allied and hostile characters.
  • Sealant Mine: Characters in the area must pass a Hull save or become Immobilized until the end of their next turn, then Slowed until the end of their subsequent turn.
  • Explosive Mine: Characters in the area must pass an Agility save or take 8/12/16 explosive damage. On a success, they take half damage.
  • Shock Mine: Characters in the area must pass a Systems save or become Jammed until the end of their next turn, then Impaired until the end of their subsequent turn.
  • Thermite Mine: Characters in the area must pass an Engineering save or take 4/5/6 Heat and have only line of sight to adjacent spaces until the end of their next turn. On a success, they take half Heat only.
The Seeder may have up to three mines deployed at a time; if they deploy another mine, one of their currently deployed mines of their choice disarms and deactivates. When the Seeder is destroyed, its deployed mines remain active, but now detonate whenever any character moves adjacent to them.

name: Safety Net
effect: The Seeder never triggers or sets off Mines or other proximity-based systems unless it chooses to do so.

name: Grav Spike
effect: A character within line of sight and Range 5 must succeed on a Systems save, or a grav spike attaches itself to them. The Seeder can detonate all grav spikes as a protocol, causing targets to automatically take 4/5/6 AP explosive damage and be pulled 3 spaces in a direction of their choice. Characters can remove a grav spike from themselves by passing a Systems save as a quick action.

name: FASCAM
effect: The Seeder launches a rocket which scatters a field of explosive micromines over a Blast 3 area within Sensors; this area can overlap with obstructions (like cover or terrain) when deployed, but not characters. Characters who enter this area or attempt to move while within it for the first time in a round must pass a Systems save or step on a mine, taking 5/6/7 explosive damage. Only one field of micromines can exist at a time, and if a new one is created, the previous one deactivates.

name: Speed Deployer
effect: Lay Mines may now deploy up to three mines at a time instead of just one. If the Seeder deploys more than one mine at a time this way, this trait can't be used again until one of its mines detonates or is disarmed.

name: Hopping Mines
effect: Mines deployed with Lay Mines also activate when hostile characters fly or move over or adjacent to them, up to 10 spaces high. The mines jump up to 10 spaces, detonating and affecting all characters within their area.

name: Last Line
effect:
Choose a mine that can be deployed with Lay Mines; the triggering character immediately detonates a hidden mine buried under the ground of that type. This Reaction may still be used even if the Seeder is destroyed.

If a hostile character is aware of this trait (i.e. via Scan, or automatically when the Seeder is destroyed), they may attempt a contested Systems check against the Seeder as a quick action while the Seeder (or its wreck) is within Sensors. If that character succeeds, this trait is disabled. This check automatically succeeds against destroyed Seeders.
trigger: A hostile character moves within Range 3 of the Seeder.

name: Eye of Midnight
effect: The Sentinel becomes Slowed, but can take the Overwatch Reaction 1/turn instead of 1/round. Additionally, they may attack with Overwatch using the Combat Shotgun when hostile characters enter, leave, or exit spaces within their Threat no matter whether they started their movement there. Once activated, this effect lasts until it is deactivated as a quick action.

name: Guardian
effect: Allied characters can use the Sentinel for hard cover.

name: Punisher Ammunition
effect: Characters hit by the Sentinel’s Overwatch attacks also become Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: Bodyguard
effect: The Sentinel chooses an allied character within Range 5 as their ward and gains the Reflexive Blow Reaction, which can be taken as many times per round as it is triggered

name: Reflexive Blow
effect: The Sentinel may move their Speed towards their ward by the most direct route possible, then attack the inciting character with Overwatch. This Reaction interrupts and resolves before the triggering action, ignores engagement, and doesn’t provoke reactions.
trigger: Someone attacks the Sentinel’s ward.

name: Wrath-Lock
effect: The Sentinel may Boost towards the triggering character, and the triggering character gains Lock On.
trigger: A hostile character in line of sight moves.

name: Impaler
effect: When the Sentinel hits with Overwatch, their target must pass a Hull save or become Immobilized and Jammed until the end of their next turn.

name: Marker Shells
effect: Characters damaged by the Sentinel's Combat Shotgun (including Reliable damage) gain a Sentinel's Mark. Whenever the Sentinel makes an Overwatch attack against a marked character, they gain +1 Accuracy and ignore Invisible. All Sentinel's Marks are cleared at the start of the Sentinel's turn.

name: Anti-Materiel Rifle
effect: This weapon does not gain Accuracy from attacking Prone targets

name: Sniper’s Mark
effect:
A character within Range 20 and line of sight gains the Sniper’s Mark. Against targets with the Sniper’s Mark, the sniper gains +1 Accuracy on attacks with the Anti-Materiel Rifle and may choose to deal 1 structure damage instead of its usual damage on hit; attacks made against a character with a Sniper's Mark this way can't be redirected, rerolled, or forced to miss by hostile effects except for Invisible and Difficulty.

Characters know when they have the Sniper's Mark They ignore its effects if they are in cover or Prone. On their turn, characters with the Sniper's Mark may drop Prone as a free action

The Sniper can only mark one character at a time, but can transfer the Sniper's Mark to another character within Range 20 and line of sight as a full action, or whenever the sniper reloads the Anti-Material Rifle.

name: Climber
effect: The Sniper treats all solid surfaces as flat ground for the purposes of movement; they can move and remain stationary on any surface without penalty, including overhanging and vertical surfaces, although they begin to fall if knocked Prone.

name: Sharpshooter
effect:
The Sniper can attempt a called shot before attacking characters with the Sniper's Mark using the Anti-Materiel Rifle. This attack functions as usual, with an additional effect on a successful attack.

The Sniper may choose from the following:
  • Target Head: Targets must pass a Hull save or only be able to draw line of sight to adjacent spaces until the end of their next turn.
  • Target Legs: Targets must pass an Agility save or be Immobilized until the end of their next turn.
  • Target Hardpoints: Targets must pass a Systems save or become Jammed until the end of their next turn.
  • Target Body: Targets must pass an Engineering save or become Shredded until the end of their next turn.

name: Shift Sights
effect: The Sniper may transfer the Sniper's Mark to a character within Range 2 of the currently marked character.

name: Defensive Grapple
effect: The Sniper uses a grappling hook to fly to any free space that ends on an object or surface within Range 5, including vertical and overhanging surfaces. The Sniper also gains the Relocation reaction.

name: Relocation
effect: The Sniper uses Defensive Grapple.
trigger: An hostile character in line of sight moves.

name: Moving Target
effect:
The Sniper interrupts the movement. The character must immediately stop, give up all remaining movement, and fall Prone or they gain the Sniper's Mark.

If they already have the Sniper's Mark, the Sniper instead may make an immediate attack against them with the Anti-Materiel Rifle.
trigger: A hostile character in line of sight and Range 20 moves.

name: Deadeye
effect: The Sniper gets +1 Accuracy on attacks with the Anti-Materiel Rifle against characters that did not move their Speed or more during their turns.

name: Monowire Sword
effect: Armor is doubled against this weapon.

name: Prowl
effect: The Specter moves spaces equal to Speed, then becomes Hidden. This movement ignores engagement and doesn’t provoke reactions.

name: Tactical Cloak
effect: The Specter is permanently Invisible. As a quick action 1/round, a character can engage in a contested Systems check with the Specter to attempt to disable their cloak; all characters are aware of this. The Specter must be within their Sensors for them to attempt this check, and it may be attempted even if the Specter is Hidden. If they succeed, this trait is disabled until the end of the Specter's next turn. If they fail, the Specter may teleport their Speed.

name: Hunt
effect: The Monowire Sword deals double damage when no other characters are adjacent to the target besides the Specter (bonus damage is not doubled).

name: Step
effect: The Specter teleports to a free space within line of sight and Range 50.

name: Drain Systems
effect: The Specter makes a tech attack against an adjacent character. On a success, the target becomes Stunned. This effect lasts until a character other than the Specter starts their turn adjacent to the target or moves adjacent to the target.

name: Lure
effect: The Specter makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, that character must choose: move their Speed towards the Specter, or become Slowed and Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Ghostwalk
effect: The Specter becomes Intangible until the start of their next turn and moves spaces equal to their Speed. At the start of their next turn, their next attack with the Monowire Sword gains +1 Accuracy and deals +1d6 bonus damage on a critical hit.

name: Machine Pistol
effect: The Specter can move 2 spaces in any direction before or after attacking with this weapon. This movement ignores engagement and doesn't provoke reactions.

name: Sealant Gun
effect:
The Support chooses a character within line of sight and Range 5, allied or hostile:
  • Allied: The target clears all Burn, but becomes Slowed until the end of their next turn.
  • Hostile: The target must pass an Agility save or become Slowed until the end of their next turn. Succeed of fail, a Burst 1 area around them becomes difficult terrain for the rest of the scene.

name: Restock Drone
effect:
Restock Drone (Size 1/2, HP {5/8/10}, Evasion {10/10/10}, E-Defense {10/10/10}, Tags: Drone)

This drone can be deployed hovering in a space within Range 5. The next time an allied character moves through or next to the drone, it clamps on and discharges its reserves, letting them either regain {5/8/10} HP or reload one Loading weapon.

name: Nano-Repair Cloud
effect: While they are adjacent to the Support, allied characters roll twice on all saves and mech skill checks and choose the higher result.

name: Desant Hardpoints
effect:
Adjacent, non-Immobilized allied characters can climb onto the Support as a quick action. While riding, they occupy the same space, move when the Support moves (even if they're Slowed), and benefit from soft cover. If they or the Support are knocked Prone, Stunned, Immobilized, or destroyed, they land Prone in adjacent spaces. Riders can climb down as part of any movement away.

The Support can carry one Squad or characters whose own combined Size is less than its own.

name: Remote Cloud
effect: The Support releases a Blast 2 nanite cloud within Range 5. Allied characters within this area gain +1 Accuracy on all checks and saves. This effect does not stack with other Remote Clouds. The cloud lasts until the end of the scene, until the Support is destroyed, or until the Support uses this system again.

name: Remote Reboot
effect: The Support clears any two of the following conditions currently affecting an allied character in Range 5: Impaired, Jammed, Stunned, Slowed. That character may then either move up to their Speed or stand from Prone.

name: Empowered Cloud
effect: When they start their turn adjacent to the Support, allied characters may clear one Condition. The Support takes 4 Heat for each condition cleared this way.

name: Latch Drone
effect:
Latch Drone (Size 1/2, HP {5/8/10}, Evasion {10/10/10}, E-Defense {10/10/10}, Tags: Drone)

This self-deploying drone clamps onto a character within Range 5, occupying the same space and moving with them. While the drone is attached, the target regains {5/8/10} HP at the start of each of their turns and gains +1 Accuracy on all checks, saves, and attacks. Enemies can target the drone with attacks. Only one Latch Drone can be deployed at a time, and if a new one is deployed, or the Support is destroyed, the old one disintegrates and is destroyed.

name: Tear Down
effect: The Witch makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target takes {1/2/3} Heat immediately, and then a further 4 Heat at the start of the Witch’s next turn; this effect does not stack. If an affected target or an adjacent hostile character takes the Stabilize action, they can choose to end the effect of this system in place of cooling their mech.

name: Blind
effect: The Witch makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target takes {2/3/4} Heat and must pass a Systems save or only be able to draw line of sight to adjacent spaces until the end of their next turn. If the target succeeds, they become Impaired until the end of their next turn instead. Characters in the Danger Zone make this save with +1 Difficulty.

name: Predatory Logic
effect: The Witch makes a tech attack against a hostile character within Sensors. On a success, the target immediately uses a non-Superheavy weapon chosen by the Witch to attack a character within Range also chosen by the Witch as a reaction. If the target takes the Brace reaction in response to this tech attack, they ignore the effect of this system; characters in the Danger Zone can't take the Brace reaction against this attack.

name: Blur
effect: The Witch counts as Invisible against characters in the Danger Zone.

name: Dark Cloud
effect: The additional Heat dealt by Tear Down on the Witch’s next turn increases to 7 Heat if the target is in the Danger Zone.

name: Chain
effect: The Witch makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the Witch chains their target’s systems to a space within Range 3 of the target. If the target moves more than 3 spaces from that point (voluntarily or otherwise), they take {2/3/4} Heat and become Jammed until the end of their next turn, but the effect ends. Otherwise, they are chained until the Witch is destroyed or Stunned, or until the end of the scene.

name: Petrify
effect: The Witch makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target becomes Slowed until the end of their next turn. When Slowed expires, they then become Immobilized until the end of their next turn. When Immobilized expires, they then become Stunned until the end of their next turn. Clearing any of these conditions (e.g. with Stabilize) prevents further conditions from occurring on subsequent turns. This system can't be used again while it is currently in the process of affecting a character, and it can only be used 1/scene on each character.

name: Pain Transference
effect: Whenever a character takes additional Heat dealt by Tear Down on the Witch’s next turn, all other hostile characters within Range 3 of that character also take the same amount of heat.

name: Immolate
effect: The Witch makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target takes burn equal to their current Heat. If the target is in the Danger Zone, all characters of the Witch's choice within a Burst 2 area around the target must pass a Systems save or take half the amount of burn that the target takes. On a miss, the target takes 2 Heat and becomes Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Chaff
effect: Grunts have 1 HP and can’t gain more, nor can they gain additional Structure or Stress. Unlike other characters, they never take damage when they succeed on a save – regardless of the weapon or system used – but otherwise take damage normally. They are immediately destroyed when they take any amount of heat.

name: Rank and File
effect: Grunts can’t take templates.

name: Necessary Modifications
effect: During scenes which take place in zero-g environments, Grunts may deploy with modifications which allow them to move normally.

name: Mass Produced
effect: Grunts all have the same Mech Skills and Core Stats; these may be modified by their type. When creating Grunts, choose which type they will be; Artillery-Type, Controller-Type, Defender-Type, Striker-Type, or Support-Type.

name: Artillery-Type
effect: Choose either the DMR or Shoulder Mortar weapon.

name: DMR
effect: This weapon gains AP against targets with Lock On.

name: Shoulder Mortar
effect: Targets with Lock On hit by this weapon take +2 bonus damage.

name: Survival Pistol
effect: The Artillery-Type may move 2 spaces in any direction before or after attacking with this weapon. This movement ignores engagement and doesn't provoke reactions.

name: Reflex Targeting
effect: The Artillery-Type has +5 Sensors, and may take the Lock On and Search actions before attacking with Ordnance weapons.

name: Hostile Sync
effect: Choose a hostile character within Sensors. While this ability is active, the Controller-Type is Immobilized but that character becomes Impaired. This effect lasts until the Controller-Type ends it as a protocol or until they are destroyed.

name: Destabilize
effect: The Controller-Type makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target is pushed 2 spaces in any direction and must pass a Systems save or be knocked Prone.

name: Electro-Chaff
effect: The Controller-Type creates a Blast 1 area within Range 5 that lasts until the end of the scene. Hostile characters that start their turn in the area or move into it for the first time on their turn take {2/3/4} heat and must pass a Systems save or become Slowed until the end of their next turn. A character can disperse this area by passing a Systems check as a quick action while adjacent to it.

name: Reinforced Systems
effect: The Controller-Type has +2 E-Defense and ignores the first amount of Heat they take during a scene.

name: Interpose
effect: That character gains Resistance to the triggering attack. The Defender-Type is then destroyed.
trigger: An allied character adjacent to the Defender-Type is hit by a non-Superheavy ranged or melee attack.

name: Ablative Armor
effect: The Defender-Type is Size 2, and begins each combat with {3/4/5} Overshield.

name: Guardian
effect: Adjacent allied characters can use the Defender-Type for hard cover.

name: Striker-Type
effect: Choose either the Assault Rifle or Heavy Blade weapon. If you choose Heavy Blade, the Striker-Type has +2 Speed.

name: Assault Rifle
effect: On Critical Hit: If the target does not have cover, the Striker-Type deals +2 bonus damage and may immediately Boost as a free action.

name: Heavy Blade
effect: On Critical Hit: The target must pass a Hull save or be knocked Prone.

name: Double Time
effect: The Striker-Type moves up to their Speed in any direction.

name: Assault Armor
effect: The Striker-Type has +2 Evasion and +1 Armor.

name: Power Transmission
effect: An allied character within Range 5 gains +1 Accuracy to all attacks, checks, and saves until the start of the Support-Type's next turn. This effect does not stack, and it immediately ends if the Support-Type is destroyed.

name: Recon Drones
effect: A hostile character within Sensors gains Lock On, then an allied character within Sensors may move 2 spaces in any direction.

name: Stabilizer Drones
effect: An allied character within Sensors gains {3/4/5} Overshield and clears Impaired and Slowed.

name: Reinforced
effect: The Veteran gains +1 Structure and +1 Stress.

name: Veterancy
effect: The Veteran gains +1 Accuracy on all checks and saves for one mech skill (chosen at creation): Hull, Agility, Systems, or Engineering.

name: Limitless
effect: The Veteran can Overcharge. Instead of the standard cost, they always gain 1d6 heat.

name: Veteran Traits
effect: The Veteran gains either a General Veteran Trait or the Class Veteran Trait corresponding to their NPC class.

name: Feign Death [General]
effect: The first time that the Veteran is destroyed each combat, they are actually feigning death - they appear to be destroyed, but have 1 HP. Characters adjacent to the Veteran can reveal this with a successful Systems check or pilot skill check; otherwise, the Veteran remains unnoticed until they move or take action.

name: Lesser Sight [General]
effect: The Veteran ignores Invisible for characters within Range 3, and hostile characters in Range 3 can’t Hide (though they remain Hidden if they were already).

name: Lightning Reflexes [General]
effect: Whenever the Veteran is attacked using any Heavy or Superheavy weapon, first roll 1d6. On 5+, the attack automatically misses. This effect does not stack with Invisible.

name: Parting Gift [General]
effect: The Veteran can Self-Destruct (see Lancer p.72).

name: Self Repair [General]
effect: 1/scene, the Veteran regains all HP and clears all conditions that weren't caused by their own systems, etc.

name: Air Superiority [Ace]
effect: 1/round, when the Ace hits a hostile character with a ranged attack, that character must pass an Agility save or immediately land if flying (this counts as falling without any damage), and additionally become unable to fly or take reactions until the end of their next turn.

name: Mobile Emitter [Aegis]
effect: The Aegis is Slowed while Defense Net is active instead of Immobilized.

name: Rock and Roll [Archer]
effect: If the Archer chooses not to move during their turn, Suppress can be used against two targets instead of one and Moving Target may be used 2/round. Each target triggers and resolves Moving Target separately, and a target damaging the Archer only ends the effect of Suppress on that target.

name: Commando [Assault]
effect: The Assault may move 2 spaces before or after attacking with the Combat Knife. This movement ignores engagement and doesn't provoke reactions. The Combat Knife gains Thrown 5, and when thrown automatically returns to the Assault at the end of their turn.

name: Whirling Death [Assassin]
effect: Whenever the Assassin reduces a hostile mech to 0 HP (causing structure damage or destroying them), they may immediately choose a new target for Assassin's Mark.

name: Remote Assemblers [Barricade]
effect: When the Barricade uses Mobile Printer, it can print cubes out to Range 10.

name: Close Protection [Bastion]
effect: Characters benefiting from Guardian's hard cover or being protected by Friendly Interdiction may use the Bastion's Armor instead of their own whenever they take damage.

name: Rending Cleave [Berserker]
effect: On hit with the Chain Axe, the Berserker deals 2/3/4 kinetic damage to a different character adjacent to either the target or the Berserker.

name: Danger Close [Bombard]
effect: When the Bombard makes an attack with the Bombard Cannon, they may exclude one character of their choice in the area from the attack.

name: Leadwall [Breacher]
