effect: Whenever the Breacher misses all attacks with the Dual Shotguns, it may make one additional attack for free.

name: Crashing Charge [Cataphract]
effect: The Cataphract may push characters affected by Trample 1 space in any direction.

name: Heavy Tread [Demolisher]
effect: All other characters treat a Burst 2 area around the Demolisher as difficult terrain.

name: Turret Nest [Engineer]
effect: All Deployable Turrets within Range 3 of the Engineer gain soft cover. While the Engineer is within Range 3 of four or more turrets, they also gain soft cover.

name: Oppression [Goliath]
effect: When the Goliath uses Crush Targeting, they may affect every hostile character within Sensors. If they do, affected characters only take +1 Difficulty to attacks instead of +3.

name: Abrade [Hive]
effect: 1/round, on a hit with the Hunter-Killer Nexus, the target must pass a Systems save or become Shredded until the end of their next turn.

name: Acrobat [Hornet]
effect: Any time an attack misses the Hornet, they may move up to 2 spaces in any direction as a reaction.

name: Sensor Lag [Mirage]
effect: 1/round, whenever the Mirage teleports an allied character, the Mirage may teleport 3 spaces in any direction as well.

name: Spec Ops [Operator]
effect: The Operator is equipped with an NHP co-pilot and gains the AI tag. Their mech is autonomous and can even function without a pilot. This NHP ignores cascade and grants the Operator Immunity to Impaired. The Operator's pilot can also Dismount. While on foot, the pilot uses the Human class and can take all actions available to PC pilots, including Jockey. When the Operator is destroyed, the pilot can immediately Eject before Self-Erasure (bringing the NHP with them).

name: Power Rerouting [Priest]
effect: Characters linked to the Priest with Investiture can Overcharge. Instead of the usual cost, the Priest takes 1d6 heat.

name: White Hot [Pyro]
effect: The Flamethrower does +2 heat on hit.

name: Concussion Warheads [Rainmaker]
effect: 1/round, when the Rainmaker consumes Lock On as part of a successful attack with the Missile Pods, they may knock the target Prone.

name: Angled Deflection [Ronin]
effect: When the Ronin uses Rebound, on a roll of 4+ they may choose to have the attacker repeat the attack against themselves or against another hostile character within Range 3 of the attacker.

name: Thermal Dissipation [Scourer]
effect: Whenever Cooling Module activates, the Scourer creates a Burst 2 area of soft cover around themselves that lasts until the start of their next turn.

name: Tactical Reposition [Scout]
effect: When the Scout uses Cloaking Field, up to two allied characters within the affected area may immediately move their Speed to any other free spaces within the affected area. This movement ignores engagement and does not provoke reactions.

name: Mag Mines [Seeder]
effect: Whenever one of the Seeder's mines is detonated by a hostile character, they may move all of their other deployed mines up to 2 spaces towards the hostile character nearest to them; if two or more hostile characters are equally close to a mine, the Seeder chooses one. All mines must end this movement in free spaces.

name: Eye of the Storm [Sentinel]
effect: When Eye of Midnight is active, the Sentinel may attack with both the Combat Shotgun and Retractable Sword each time it takes the Overwatch reaction.

name: Blinding Laser [Sniper]
effect: Whenever a character gains the Sniper's Mark, they must pass a Systems save or become Impaired and Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: Silent Stalker [Specter]
effect: The Specter can become Hidden while Engaged, and while Hidden can move through (but not stop in) spaces occupied by hostile characters.

name: Whitewash Coordinator [Support]
effect: When the Support uses Sealant Gun on an allied character, it does not cause them to become Slowed. When used on a hostile character, the target is also knocked Prone if they fail the Agility save.

name: Enfeeble [Witch]
effect: When the Witch uses the Invade Quick Tech action, on hit the target is also Slowed until the end of their next turn.

name: Best of the Best
effect: The Ultra can’t take the Elite or Grunt templates.

name: Resilient
effect: The Ultra gains +5 HP.

name: Reinforced
effect: The Ultra gains +3 Structure and +3 Stress.

name: Shock and Awe
effect: The Ultra takes two separate turns each round. They regain spent reactions each time they take a turn. If the Ultra is facing five or more hostile characters when combat begins, the Ultra takes a third turn each round.

name: Deadly
effect: The Ultra deals +1d6 bonus damage on critical hits.

name: Juggernaut
effect: At the start of the Ultra’s turn, they may clear one condition. If they do, they choose one; become Impaired until the end of their turn, take 5 energy damage that can't be reduced in any way, or instead of two quick actions or a full action during their turn, they may only take one quick action.

name: Auto-Repair Functions
effect: At the end of the Ultra's turn, they may repair one destroyed weapon or system of their choice. If they do, they choose one; become Jammed until the start of their next turn, or take 1d6 heat.

name: Legendary
effect: The Ultra rolls all structure damage and overheating checks twice and chooses either result.

name: Reflex
effect: The Ultra can Overwatch unlimited times per round.

name: Advanced Kit
effect: The Ultra chooses 1-2 additional optional systems from their class.

name: Ultra Systems and Traits
effect: The Ultra chooses 1-3 options from the Ultra Systems and Traits list.

name: Aceso Flock
effect: Up to two allied characters within Range 5 gain {4/5/6} Overshield, and while they have this Overshield they have Immunity to Impaired and Jammed (clearing those conditions if they already have them).

name: All-Theater EX Suite
effect: The Ultra can hover whenever they move.

name: Grind Maniple
effect: The Ultra makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, a swarm of tiny, hard to hit drones clamp onto the target, causing them to take 2 burn each time they take any action or reaction until the end of their next turn.

name: Harbinger Rockets
effect: The Ultra launches a salvo of powerful rockets, targeting one space of their choice occupied by each hostile non-Drone character within Range 30 and line of sight; all characters know that these spaces have been chosen. At the end of the next round, these rockets impact, creating a Blast 2 explosion centered on each targeted space. Characters in these affected areas must pass an Agility save or take {10/14/18} explosive damage and become Shredded until the end of their next turn. On a success, they take half damage only.

name: H0R_OS v?? Puppet Crasher
effect: The Ultra makes a tech attack against a hostile character within Sensors. On a success, they take {2/3/4} heat, gain Lock On, become Impaired until the end of their next turn, and move their Speed in a direction of the Ultra's choice. This movement is involuntary, but provokes reactions and Engagement as normal and doesn’t count as Knockback, pushing, or pulling.

name: Ontolotactical Array
effect: Whenever an allied character within Range 10 attempts an attack roll, check, or save, the Ultra may grant them additional Accuracy on that roll by expending charges from this system; this doesn't take an action, but can't be used if the Ultra is Jammed or Stunned. Up to 2 charges can be expended per roll this way. The Ultra regains 1 charge each time they end their turn without having made any attacks or forced any saves, and each time they take stress or structure damage, to a maximum of 6.

name: Orbital Eye
effect: All hostile characters in a Blast 2 area within Sensors gain Lock On.

name: Repulsion Field
effect: When hostile characters start their turn adjacent to the Ultra or become adjacent to the Ultra for the first time on their turn, they take {2/3/4} AP energy damage and must pass a Systems save or be knocked back 2 spaces and become Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Sidereal Realignment
effect: Up to three characters within Sensors are pulled 1 space in any direction of your choice. Characters that have one or more conditions (Impaired, Slowed, etc) may be pulled 2 spaces instead.

name: Siege Shield
effect: This system replaces Resilient. The Ultra gains Resistance to all damage from attacks that originate beyond Range 3.

name: Slivershielding
effect: This system replaces Resilient. The Ultra becomes permanently Invisible.

name: Short-Cycle Lance
effect:
This powerful lance weapon begins charging during the Ultra's turn, which is visible to all characters. Set a Charge Die, 1d6, starting at 6. At the start of each of the Ultra's turns, reduce the value of the Charge Die by 1, then roll 1d6: on 5+, reduce the value by another 1. The value is also reduced by 1 each time the Ultra takes stress or structure damage.

When the Charge Die reaches 1, the Ultra may reset it to 6 and, as a full action, draw a Line 30 path. All sources of cover, terrain, objects, and deployables smaller than Size 5 are completely annihilated, and then all characters within the affected area must pass an Agility save or take 1 structure damage. On a success, they are reduced to 1 HP.

name: Suppression Pulse
effect: All hostile characters in a Blast 2 area within Sensors must pass a Systems save or become Jammed until the end of their next turn. On a success, they become Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Volley Module
effect: The Ultra adopts a stable stance and prepares one of their weapons. On their next turn, as a protocol, the Ultra uses the prepared weapon to attack any number of characters once, as long as they are within Range, and aren't in cover or Prone. All characters are aware of this attack and can choose to drop Prone as a free action on their turn to avoid being targeted.

name: Wolfhound Missile
effect:
Wolfound Missile (Size 1/2, HP {10/12/14}, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone, Immunity to Prone, Slowed, and Immobilized).

The Ultra deploys the Wolfound Missile in an adjacent space and picks a target in Range 30 and line of sight. At the start of the Ultra’s turns the missile makes its own standard move, flying 4 spaces towards its target, 8 if the target has Lock On. It moves directly, maneuvering around cover and terrain if needed. When the missile moves adjacent to its target, or collides with any character, it creates a Burst 2 explosion. Characters in the affected area must pass an Agility save or take {14/20/28} explosive damage. On a success, they take half damage.

Any hostile character that attempts to move a Wolfound Missile (i.e. with Knockback, push, pull, etc) must pass a contested Systems check against the Ultra. If they fail, the movement is ignored, and the missile immediately moves another 4 spaces towards its target.

name: Argus Armor
effect: The Ultra has 6 Armor instead of its normal value. Each time they roll a structure damage or overheating check, they lose 2 Armor to a minimum of 0. While at 0 Armor, the Ultra gains +1 Accuracy on all attacks.

name: Devastator
effect: 1/round, when the Ultra makes a successful attack, they may deal 30 AP explosive damage to an object or piece of terrain within line of sight. All characters adjacent to that object or piece of terrain take {3/4/5} kinetic damage.

name: Greater Sight
effect: The Ultra ignores Invisible for characters within Range 10, and hostile characters in Range 10 can’t Hide (though they remain Hidden if they were already). As a quick action 1/round, a character can engage in a contested Systems check with the Ultra to attempt to disable this trait; all characters are aware of this. The Ultra must be within their Sensors for them to attempt this check. If they succeed, this trait is disabled until the end of the Ultra's next turn. If they fail, that character gains Lock On becomes Impaired until the end of their next turn.

name: Evasive
effect: The Ultra gains +4 Evasion (to a maximum of 20), +1 Accuracy on all saves, and -1 Structure.

name: Legion
effect: The Ultra gains +4 E-Defense (to a maximum of 20) and +1 Accuracy on all tech attacks.

name: Limitless
effect: The Ultra can Overcharge. Instead of the standard cost, they always gain 1d6 heat.

name: Superior Shielding
effect: This trait replaces Resilient. At the start of the Ultra's turn, the Ultra chooses one damage type - kinetic, explosive, or energy damage - and gains Resistance to that damage until the start of their next turn. The Ultra can’t gain Resistance to more than two of these damage types at a time, whether from this or any other system.

name: Superior Construction
effect: The Ultra gains +5 HP. When using Juggernaut, the Ultra may clear two conditions at a time instead of one. Different costs must be chosen for each condition cleared this way.

name: Superior Frame
effect: When using Juggernaut, the Ultra may clear either Slowed or Immobilized by taking 4 heat instead of the usual costs.

name: Superior Reactor
effect: While the Ultra is Exposed, all attacks against them are made with +1 Difficulty. Whenever the Ultra takes kinetic, explosive, or energy damage while Exposed, they clear Exposed immediately afterward and clear all heat.

name: Supreme Logistics
effect: 1/turn as a quick action, the Ultra may either repair a destroyed weapon or system belonging to them or an adjacent ally, or reload one Loading weapon belonging to them or an adjacent ally.

name: Supreme Melee
effect: 1/turn as a free action, the Ultra may Grapple or Ram. The Ultra counts as 1 Size larger for the purpose of grapples (up to a maximum of Size 3), and on a successful Ram they knock targets back 2 spaces instead of 1.

name: Supreme Mobility
effect: 1/turn as a free action, the Ultra may Boost. One allied character they start this Boost adjacent to may immediately Boost as a reaction.

name: Unstoppable
effect: The Ultra gains Immunity to Prone, and may ignore involuntary movement (Knockback, push, pull, etc) by taking 1 kinetic damage per point of movement ignored; this damage can't be reduced in any way.

name: Hellfire Projector
effect: This weapon can make two attacks at a time, but the area of these two attacks can’t overlap.

name: Hyperdense Blade
effect:
On Critical Hit: The target is knocked Prone, and the Ultra can make another attack against a different target within range. Only one additional attack can be made this way per turn.

If the Ultra adopts a stabilized stance as a protocol and becomes Immobilized until the start of its next turn, attacks with this weapon gain +1 Accuracy and deal double Knockback on hit.

name: Miniaturized Railgun
effect: The Ultra may ignore Ordnance when attacking with this weapon. If they do, it gains 4 Heat (Self) and makes attacks with +1 Difficulty

name: Nova Missiles
effect: If the Ultra does not make any other attacks during their turn, they may attack with this weapon as a free action.

name: Ravager Turret
effect: This weapon attacks every hostile character within line of sight and Range.

name: Wraith Nexus
effect:
On Critical Hit: The target must pass a Systems save, or the Ultra chooses one:
  • The target becomes Slowed until the end of their next turn.
  • The target becomes Shredded until the end of their next turn.
  • The target only has line of sight to adjacent spaces until the end of their next turn.
